text: For automata M, let (M) denote some unary encoding of M, and L(M) denote the set of strings, over {0, 1}, accepted by M. Which of the following languages are Turing-recognizable? A. {(M)|M s a (deterministic) Turing machine and M accepts 010}. B. {(M)|M is a nondeterministic Turing machine and M accepts 010}. C. {(M)|M s a Turing machine and M does not accept 101}. D. {(M) | M is a Turing machine and L(M) = Z*}.
